title._content: ["The Reef,"  Theodore Montgomery Davis house, Ocean Avenue at Brenton Point, Newport, Rhode Island. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["The Reef," Theodore Montgomery Davis house, Ocean Avenue at Brenton Point, Newport, Rhode Island. Pathway] [1914] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Sturgis & Brigham, built 1885. Landscape: Frederick Law Olmsted; Angus Macmillan, gardener. Today: House razed in 1963 and grounds subdivided. On slide (handwritten): "D," "Davis, T.B., Newport" and no. "27..." Also, blue star sticker. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Gardens--Rhode Island--Newport--1910-1920. Trails & paths--Rhode Island--Newport--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16241 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 32
